poem:
**Voices in the Wind**

Starmer's steps —  
a rhythm, a stubborn beat,  
cut through clustered murmurs  
like skiffs on midnight waters.  
In the cavernous echo—  
working hands,  
leave-light dreams,  
women's whispering questions.

He stands,  
a figure against the tide,  
hearing only the sea.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Starmer dismisses welfare cuts revolt as ‘noises off’ and defends his leadership – UK politics live 5.02pm BST People who voted Labour in 2024 but who now say they would not support the party are disproportionately working class, or leave-supporting, or female, according to researach published by YouGov. In his YouGov write-up, Dylan Difford says: Compared to those 2024 Labour voters who’ve stuck with the party over the last year, Labour defectors are less likely". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Starmer dismisses welfare cuts revolt as ‘noises off’ and defends his leadership – UK politics live 5.02pm BST People who voted Labour in 2024 but who now say they would not support the party are disproportionately working class, or leave-supporting, or female, according to researach published by YouGov. In his YouGov write-up, Dylan Difford says: Compared to those 2024 Labour voters who’ve stuck with the party over the last year, Labour defectors are less likely
